quiz.title: AP Calculus AB/BC: Optimization & Related Rates Quiz
quiz.subtitle: Unit 5 & 4 Review: Real-World Applications (10 Problems)
quiz.subject: AP Calculus

questions.question: A cylindrical can (with top and bottom) must contain 500 cm³ of liquid. To minimize material, the height should be:
questions.explanation: V = πr²h = 500 → h = 500/(πr²). Surface area S = 2πr² + 2πrh = 2πr² + 1000/r. Minimize: S'(r)=4πr − 1000/r²=0 → r³=250/π → h=2r, so height = diameter.

questions.question: A poster has 50 in² printed area with 2 in margins top/bottom and 1 in margins sides. Minimum total poster area occurs when printed width =
questions.explanation: Let printed width x, height y: xy=50 → y=50/x. Poster width = x+2, height = y+4. Total area A=(x+2)(50/x+4). A'(x)=4−100/x²=0 → x=5.

questions.question: A 10 ft ladder slides with bottom moving away from wall at 1 ft/s. When bottom is 6 ft from wall, top slides down at:
questions.explanation: x²+y²=100, dx/dt=1. Differentiate: 2x dx/dt+2y dy/dt=0. At x=6, y=8 → 6(1)+8 dy/dt=0 → dy/dt=−6/8=−0.75 ft/s.

questions.question: Two positive numbers with product 100 have minimum sum when they are:
questions.explanation: Let numbers x and y: xy=100 → y=100/x. Sum S=x+100/x. S'(x)=1−100/x²=0 → x²=100 → x=10, y=10.

questions.question: Particle moves on y=√x. At (4,2), dx/dt=3 cm/s. Rate of distance to origin changing is:
questions.explanation: r²=x²+y²=x²+x → 2r dr/dt=2x dx/dt+dx/dt. At (4,2): r=√20=2√5 → 4√5 dr/dt=27 → dr/dt=27√5/20.

questions.question: Man crosses river 3 km wide, B is 8 km downstream. Row 6 km/h, run 8 km/h. He should land how far downstream from opposite point?
questions.explanation: Let x km downstream landing. Time T=√(9+x²)/6+(8−x)/8. T'(x)=x/(6√(9+x²))−1/8=0 → 8x=6√(9+x²) → x=9/√7.

Conical tank: height 6 m, top radius 2 m. Water leaks at 0.01 m³/min, level rises 0.2 m/min at h=2 m. Pump rate ≈
Open-top box with square base, volume 32,000 cm³. Minimum surface area occurs when base side =
questions.explanation: Base x, height h: x²h=32000 → h=32000/x². Surface S=x²+4xh=x²+128000/x. S'(x)=2x−128000/x²=0 → x³=64000 → x=40 cm.

questions.question: Spotlight: wall 12 m away, man 2 m tall walks toward wall at 1.5 m/s. At 4 m from wall, shadow height decreases at:
questions.explanation: Let x=distance from spotlight to man. Shadow height y=24/x. dy/dt=−24/x² dx/dt. At x=8 m (4 m from wall), dx/dt=1.5 → dy/dt=−24/64×1.5=−0.5625 m/s.
